intro: Microlicia bryanthoides, commonly known as the slender microlicia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of pink to purple flowers that bloom during the wet season. Microlicia bryanthoides is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
